page.title: 12ECONOMIC FORESTRY GROUP.
page.content: The EFG is a company who look after trees for private owners.They look after them for 2 or 3 years.By that time they are a little bigger.But the EFG still keep an eye on young trees until they are about five or six years old and then they leave the trees to grow. The EFG has to keep the deer numbers down by shooting them and they freeze them in a big freezer in a shed near the EFG offices and then when they are frozen they sell them. The EFG shoot the deer because the deer eat the bark off the trees. This is the same problem as the Forestry Commission.The trees are planted to about 350 metres and the deer graze near the top. The deer are very fond of young, juicy trees!
